data.title: Technical Lab Specialist
data.description: Position Name: Technical Lab SpecialistLocation: Charlotte NC 28208Available Shifts : Days/ Mon-FriDuration: Permanent Job Summary: Develops and applies technology, methods, and training across a wide array of disciplines and processes, with the goal of improving quality and efficiency.Scope of responsibility spans the entire clinical laboratory value stream, including Test menu/dictionary, equipment implementation, results reporting, and technical consultation. Essential Functions: Ensures all requirements of applicable regulatory agencies (federal, state, local) are always satisfied. Leads continuous accreditation readiness efforts and collaborates with others in the development of improvement capabilities.Facilitates assessments, develops, implements, and evaluates corrective action plans based on past surveys and preparatory tracer activities.Collaborates with key teammates (operational leaders, key operators, technical staff, professional partners) for implementation of technical methods in clinical area of expertise.Improves quality and efficiency by analyzing and planning workflow, space requirements, and equipment layout in partnership with department leaders.Collaborates with vendors, technical directors, quality, and lab team to create a standardized method validation plan for new equipment. Focuses on streamlining implementation, meeting minimal manufacture requirements, while remaining compliant with accreditation agencies.Ensures all equipment is implemented in an integrated fashion, optimizing the mix of technology, information systems, and processes to support operational and customer needs.Participates in creation of standard work, sharing technical expertise to optimize efficiencies for continuous improvement.Practice and teach critical thinking and problem-solving skills to create an environment of continuous quality improvement. Identifies performance improvement opportunities that impact operational & quality metrics. Utilizes the PDSA (Plan-Do-Study-Act) cycle to document improvements.Designs and conducts experiment to evaluate new methods with the goal of furthering the scope, quality, and efficiency of clinical laboratory services.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; and participating in professional societies. Skills: Method ValidationManagerial metricsClinical LaboratoryProblem-Solving  Education: Bachelor's degree in medical technology, business, manufacturing, or related field is required.Master's degree in health administration, Business, Science, or another related field is desirable.A minimum of five 5 years of relevant leadership experience is required.Can include Group Leader experience.Demonstrated track record of achieving results. Required: ASHI Cert preferred.Bachelor's in biology or science field Min of 4-5 years of histocompatibility, HLA, and Flow cytometry experience.Team Lead or Lead Tech experience required.Experience with software systems EPIC or Histotrack preferred.

data.title: Property Controller
data.description:
Robert Half is reviewing candidates for an ambitious Property Controller opening, who is seeking to contribute their skills to a prominent company. In this leadership position, you will direct an accounting and clerical department. As the Controller, you will be planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff. We are seeking an individual for this role who is able to motivate others by maintaining a positive professional attitude; exhibit integrity, reliability and leadership; and is capable of providing exceptional client services by managing self and others by responding with a sense of urgency, practicality and accountability. The Property Controller will be a permanent employment opportunity and will be located in the Philadelphia region.
Major responsibilities:Preparation of general ledger, cash reporting and reconciliations for various development projectsReview of financial statements prepared by various external property managersEvaluation and proposal of accounting adjustments needed on property manager booksPrepares monthly, quarterly & annual financial reports as requiredCoordination and review of loan and operating covenants for various development projectThe ideal Property Controller candidate should have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education.
Other requirements for the Property Controller position include and are not limited to:5+ years of experience requiredCommercial real estate accounting experience requiredGreat Plains/Yardi (or similar property management software) preferredHighly organized with attention to detail and accuracy Team player with strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Interested candidates should reach out to Jessica Heilweil at 267-996-4167 and reference JO#03720-0012958620

data.title: Senior Software Engineer
data.description:
High Frequency Trading Firm looking to bring on a Senior Quantitative Developer. ResponsibilitiesWriting clean, high-quality, high-performance, maintainable codeDevelop and support softwareCoordinate cross-functionally with researchers, traders, and developers to deliver technical solutionsProficiency in C++ and/or Python - 80% hands on coding.Greenfield development
Qualifications
Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science (or related field).6+ years of relevant work experience within finance.Expertise in data structures, algorithms, optimization, low latency, etc.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Ability to perform in a fast paced environment + respond quickly for technical solutions.

data.title: Director of Construction
data.description: Are you a results-driven operations executive with a systems mindset and a knack for driving positive change? We're actively seeking a dynamic Director of Construction with a solid understanding of commercial construction and specifically extensive experience in multifamily to oversee all aspects of project execution and spearhead our operational growth initiatives. In this pivotal role for our construction operations division, reporting directly to the CEO, you will be the driving force behind aligning our strategic vision with operational excellence.As a leader focused on achieving tangible results, we are looking for someone with a decisive leadership style to play a key role in steering our company toward expansion and prosperity. If you are passionate about making a significant impact on a growing company and possess the assertiveness and attention to detail needed to drive success, let's connect. Join us in shaping the future and turning ambitious plans into concrete success!This position is located in Tuscaloosa, Alabama where the Gulf Coastal and Piedmont plains meet. It is Alabama's fifth-most populous city. Tuscaloosa is the regional center of industry, commerce, healthcare and education for the area of west-central Alabama known as West Alabama. It is the home of the University of Alabama, which is the city's dominant economic and cultural engine, making it a college town. City leaders adopted the moniker "The City of Champions".﻿Qualified, interested candidates should send their resume directly to Doug McCright at DirectorofConstructionAL@gmail.com for consideration NO PHONE CALLS - NO RECRUITERS PLEASE About BMCC:The Morrow Companies were founded in 1961 and have grown into a collection of companies providing fully integrated multi-family real estate services and commercial construction. The company has extensive knowledge and experience in the development of affordable apartment communities.The Morrow Companies are recognized as the 8th largest Rural Developer nationwide, the 10th largest Rural Owners nationwide, and the 16th largest Rural Management Company nationwide. The strength and capacity of the Morrow Companies is a result of the top-notch professional team members dedicated to providing exceptional work and service to our clients.Bob Morrow Construction Company, Inc. (BMCC) is a licensed General Contractor in multiple states in the southeast US. Core Roles & Responsibilities: As the Director of Construction, you play a pivotal role within the Leadership Team, overseeing project management, field operations, and safety. · Lead, manage, and hold accountable project managers and the field operations leaders.· Ensure projects come in within budget. · Ensure the achievement of gross margin goals and identify cost-saving opportunities in project execution.· Guarantee timely project completion and identify opportunities to streamline operational processes.· Maintain a focus on delivering high-quality work safely and consistently providing excellent customer experiences. Primary Duties: · Participate in establishing company-level strategic plans as a key member of the Leadership Team.· Coach, mentor, and guide project managers, the field leaders and the safety team.· Establish and track key metrics to proactively guide decisions including priority setting and resource management. · Collaborate with the controller to oversee the financial performance of all construction projects.· Hold project managers accountable for results, providing guidance and support as needed.· Support the field leaders with finding opportunities to enhance production and meet manpower needs.· Collaborate with the safety team to instill a safety-first mindset company-wide.· Work with sales and preconstruction leaders to ensure accurate estimates.· Collaborate with the HR leader to maintain top-notch onboarding and training programs for continual learning and development.· Continuously refine operational processes and implement systems to ensure consistent adherence by team members.· Lead and maintain contract review and compliance protocols, ensuring teams are aware of relevant contract provisions.· Make sound decisions, balancing customer experience with protecting the company against unnecessary risk and loss.· Perform other duties as required to support the company's success. Experience Requirements:  · Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management or related field. · At least 15 years of commercial construction experience with significant multifamily experience · At least 5 years of experience leading, managing, and holding Project Managers accountable· Should hold or be able to take contractor license in states company builds in · Experience and interest in navigating contentious issues, leveraging legal resources, and making solid decisions· Proven results in establishing and optimizing processes and associated trainings, ensuring consistency and compliance · Demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through others· Demonstrated ability to think ahead and plan · Excellent organizational, leadership and analytical skills· Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing· Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities· Problem analysis and problem resolution; sound judgment· Detailed knowledge of construction process· Ability to read and understand technical and statistical data, interpret construction drawings, architectural drawings and specifications, and legal documents· Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with a wide cross section of individuals The Morrow Companies were founded in 1961 and have grown into a collection of companies providing fully integrated multi-family real estate services and commercial construction. The company has extensive knowledge and experience in the development of affordable apartment communities.The Morrow Companies are recognized as the 8th largest Rural Developer nationwide, the 10th largest Rural Owners nationwide, and the 16th largest Rural Management Company nationwide. The strength and capacity of the Morrow Companies is a result of the top-notch professional team members dedicated to providing exceptional work and service to our clients.Bob Morrow Construction Company, Inc. (BMCC) is a licensed General Contractor in multiple states in the southeast US. NO PHONE CALLS - NO RECRUITERS PLEASE

data.title: Contract Analyst/Corporate Paralegal
data.description:
Beacon Hill Legal is seeking a full-time, detail-oriented and self-motivated Contract Analyst/Corporate Paralegal to join a company located in the Northwest Suburbs! This role is responsible for handling a variety of contract-related tasks, including review, drafting, and negotiation. Additionally, this individual will assist with general corporate legal and compliance work, litigation support, and special projects.

Job Title: Contract Analyst/Corporate ParalegalLocation: Northwest Suburbs, ILSchedule: Full-time in-office, Monday-Friday.Salary: Depends on experience, up to $85K! Responsibilities:Review, draft, edit, and redline contracts and other legal documentsTrack and support litigation efforts internally and with outside counselEngage and support outside counsel and other professionals for various responsibilitiesMaintain business filings for various corporate entitiesHandle assigned projects which may include research, analysis, and compiling dataReview and analyze legal billsMaintain follow-up calendar for legal and corporate mattersOrganize and maintain legal filesPerform other projects or duties as assignedQualifications/Requirements:Bachelor's or Associate Degree and/or Paralegal Certificate4 or more years of related experienceHighly detail oriented with excellent written and verbal communication skillsWell organized with strong follow-up skillsStrong prioritization and multitasking abilitiesProficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)Benefits:Competitive salaryHealth, dental, and vision insuranceRetirement savings planPaid time offOpportunities for growth and advancement *Only qualified candidates will be contacted*    
Beacon Hill is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.
If you would like to complete our voluntary self-identification form, please click here or copy and paste the following link into an open window in your browser: https://jobs.beaconhillstaffing.com/eeoc/
Completion of this form is voluntary and will not affect your opportunity for employment, or the terms or conditions of your employment. This form will be used for reporting purposes only and will be kept separate from all other records.
Company Profile:
Founded by industry leaders to set a new standard in search, career placement and flexible staffing, we deliver coordinated staffing solutions with unparalleled service, a commitment to project completion and success and a passion for innovation, creativity and continuous improvement.
Our niche brands offer a complete suite of staffing services to emerging growth companies and the Fortune 500 across market sectors, career specialties/disciplines and industries. Over time, office locations, specialty practice areas and service offerings will be added to address ever changing constituent needs.
Learn more about Beacon Hill Staffing Group and our specialty divisions, Beacon Hill Associates, Beacon Hill Financial, Beacon Hill HR, Beacon Hill Legal, Beacon Hill Life Sciences and Beacon Hill Technologies by visiting www.beaconhillstaffing.com.
We look forward to working with you.

Beacon Hill. Employing the Future (TM)

data.description:
Registered Nurse - RN - Skilled Nursing Facility
CareerStaff Unlimited - Montgomeryville, PA
2024-04-02
Job Attributes
Qualifications
Years of Experience Less Than One Year
Certifications RN
Job Features
Shifts Evenings
Shift Length 8

Registered Nurse - RN - Skilled Nursing Facility
Experience success from day one as a Registered Nurse at a Montgomeryville, PA facility that will equip you to succeed! On top of a $48/hr pay rate, you will also enjoy a welcome orientation with a personal shadowing experience to help you acclimate to the facility. Enjoy a top-of-the-line EMR system to simplify care and a comfortable atmosphere to make your impact as a Registered Nurse.
PAY:
$1,536/Weekly Gross
$48/Hourly
32 hours/Week
ABOUT CAREERSTAFF UNLIMITED:
CareerStaff Unlimited, LLC ("CareerStaff") is a renowned industry leader in healthcare staffing, managed services, and workforce solutions. For over 30 years, we've connected our clients with talented healthcare professionals to deliver proven excellence in patient care. With a gold star in Joint Commission-certified healthcare services, we offer per diem, local, and travel career opportunities for allied, interim healthcare leadership, nursing, and pharmacy.
CAREERSTAFF BENEFITS FOR THE RN REGISTERED NURSE:
Flexible Day, Night, or Weekend ScheduleMedical, Vision, Dental, and 401(k)Guaranteed Weekly Direct Deposit24/7 Clinical Services Team & Unparalleled SupportBonus Programs available!
Our strong, long-term connections with exclusive healthcare facilities mean a new world of possibilities for your career! Opportunities with CareerStaff put you on an inside track to give you access to more career opportunities and get your dream job faster than going at it alone.
MORE ABOUT THE RN REGISTERED NURSE POSITION:
CareerStaff Unlimited partners with companies around the country to raise the bar in healthcare by setting new standards for quality care and personalized service. Responsibilities for this Registered Nurse opportunity include, but are not limited to:
Demonstrate excellence in customer service and public relations to promote a positive professional imageWork independently with attention to detail and possess the necessary knowledge of all aspects of daily operationsFoster a caring environment that respects patient's dignityPerform comprehensive health assessments of residents, including vital signs, medical history, and current health statusDeliver and evaluate all patient care providedAdminister medications according to physician orders, ensuring accurate dosage and proper documentationMonitor and manage chronic health conditions, such as diabetes, hypertension, and respiratory disorders, adapting care plans as neededRemain flexible to work a variable schedule that includes early start times, late end times, weekends, and holidaysEducate residents and their families on health conditions, medications, and preventive measures to promote overall well-beingBe a model of professionalism and compassion by serving as an ambassador to this organization
JOB REQUIREMENTS FOR THE RN REGISTERED NURSE:
6 months of recent nursing experience requiredBLS issued through American Heart Association or American Red CrossMust be eligible to work in the United StatesRN license in PA
CareerStaff is proud to be a six-time Great Place to Work™ and Diversity for Social Impact™ certified source of healthcare careers. Our award-winning team of recruitment professionals connects clinicians with unique career opportunities nationwide that match your lifestyle. Premium pay, exclusive benefits, and unparalleled customer service make CareerStaff the top choice for over 6,500 healthcare professionals.
CareerStaff Unlimited is proud to practice Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action (EEO/AA).

data.title: Senior Blockchain Engineer (Rust & Solana) - 100% Remote
data.description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

VC backed stealth startup is hiring for a Staff Protocol Engineer!

This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $150,000 - $800,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Well-funded, stealth startup, is making waves in the crypto space and poised to reshape the future of blockchain. Backed by industry giants like Polychain and the Solana Foundation, alongside other reputable firms, they are experiencing rapid growth and expanding their exceptional team.. I've placed a few people with them and all have had fantastic feedback on the culture and opportunity.

What's their product? They are building what Microservices was for Web2, for Web3. They are on forefront of pioneering a cutting-edge, high-performance, modular infrastructure that scales blockchains to new heights. They are separating the "slow" parts of blockchains from executing programs and data availability, drawing inspiration from successful projects like Cosmos and Polkadot, but with unparalleled speed.

Why is this groundbreaking? By enabling users to deploy their applications as fully customizable rollups, they empower developers to select their ideal base layer, choose from a range of virtual machines (EVM, SVM, Move), and implement additional modifications for enhanced value accrual. With this infrastructure, any application can scale and spin out as its own blockchain without compromising security.

They are looking for a Senior to Staff Software Engineer who thrives on building mission-critical systems. If you have experience in distributed systems and a minimum of 1.5 years of expertise with Rust, this role is tailor-made for you.

Projects You Might Work On

 Build their novel trust-minimized (honest minority) settlement layer for Solana VM rollups Support additional bytecodes for rollups Integrate oracles so they automatically work all of their rollups Customize by the request of dApps deploying to them



Why join us?


 100% Remote and US-based Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity.  Great health benefits package, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity  Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.

Job Details

Are you passionate about building mission-critical systems and eager to make a meaningful impact in the crypto space? Look no further! We have a fantastic opportunity just for you. Our dynamic and innovative crypto native startup is seeking talented individuals with a minimum of 1.5 years of experience in Rust. We are specifically looking for professionals who have worked in the crypto industry or at a crypto native startup, as your expertise and understanding of the unique challenges and requirements of the crypto space will be invaluable. Join our team and be part of an exciting journey at the forefront of crypto innovation.

Qualifications

 4-10+ years of software engineering experience Strong expertise in Rust, minimum of 1.5 years Experience at a Crypto Native startup Skilled in building distributed systems Experience with building high performant, high-throughput systems Bachelor’s in EECS, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent from a top CS program Bonus Familiarity with optimistic & zero-knowledge tech

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

data.title: Multi-Strat Hedge Fund | Senior Software Engineer
data.description:
Hedge Fund | Experience Software EngineerSelby Jennings is working with one of the most successful hedge funds in the world. This firm has stood the test of time for decades bringing consistent, high returns to their investors. They have been able to accomplish this by leveraging state-of-the-art technology, hiring exceptional engineers, and driving a highly collaborative culture.
Currently, they are seeking a quantitative software engineer to join one of their most high-performing teams. Essentially, this team is like a startup within the firm and tackles the business objectives of the highest priority. This candidate must come from a quantitative finance background as they will build and scale one of the largest equities portfolios in the market by optimizing various aspects of the investment, risk management, portfolio construction, and trade execution lifecycle.
Qualifications & Requirements:7-12 years of professional experience5+ years of Python programming experience including scientific libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, etc)Experience with a least two languages other than PythonAnalytical skills – Ability to troubleshoot and logically assess problems and determine solutionsDegree in Computer Science, or other related fields (MS or PhD is a plus!)
Great-to-haves:Startup experienceBig tech experience using machine learning in a recommendations teamBasic knowledge of statisticsExperience with financial modeling and pricingExperience acquiring, analyzing, and organizing time-series, financial data, and fundamental data

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

Are you a skilled and passionate oral surgeon looking for an exciting opportunity to showcase your expertise and contribute to a dynamic, patient-focused practice? Jacksonville Oral Surgery is seeking a talented and driven individual to join our team as a Full-Time Oral Surgeon. This is your chance to make a significant impact on the lives of patients while working in a collaborative and supportive environment.

Why Choose Jacksonville Oral Surgery

 Cutting-Edge Facilities: We boast state-of-the-art surgical facilities equipped with the latest technology and tools, enabling you to provide the highest standard of care to our diverse patient population. Collaborative Team: You'll be working alongside a team of experienced professionals who are dedicated to providing comprehensive oral surgical solutions. Collaboration and knowledge-sharing are at the core of our practice. Varied Cases: From routine extractions and dental implant placements to complex reconstructive surgeries, you'll have the opportunity to handle a wide range of cases, continuously enhancing your skills and expanding your expertise. Patient-Centered Care: At Jacksonville Oral Surgery, our patients are our top priority. We pride ourselves on delivering personalized and compassionate care to ensure our patients' comfort and satisfaction throughout their treatment journey. Professional Growth: We are committed to fostering your professional growth and development. Whether it's through continuing education opportunities or exposure to challenging cases, we'll support your journey to excellence. Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You'll have a predictable schedule that allows you to enjoy all that Jacksonville and its surroundings have to offer. Compensation Range: $600,000 - $800,000

If you're a dedicated and passionate oral surgeon looking to make a lasting impact on patients' lives, we encourage you to apply by submitting your CV. Our team is excited to welcome a new member who shares our commitment to excellence in oral surgical care.

At Jacksonville Oral Surgery, you'll find more than just a job – you'll find a fulfilling career where your skills and passion will thrive. Join us in shaping the future of oral surgery and improving the lives of our patients. Apply today!

Responsibilities

 Perform a wide range of oral and maxillofacial surgeries, including extractions, dental implant placement, orthognathic surgery, and more.  Develop treatment plans tailored to individual patient needs and preferences.  Collaborate with our dedicated team to ensure seamless patient care and satisfaction.  Stay current with the latest advancements in oral surgery through continuous education and professional development. 

Qualifications

 DDS/DMD from an accredited Dental School  Certificate from an accredited US Oral Surgery Residency Program  Active Dental License in the state of Florida 

#rup

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

Are you a skilled and dedicated oral surgeon looking to make a significant impact on patients' lives? Look no further! Arkansas Maxillofacial Surgery Center - Little Rock is excited to announce a full-time opening for an experienced and compassionate Oral Surgeon to join our esteemed team. If you are committed to providing exceptional patient care, demonstrating surgical expertise, and contributing to a dynamic and collaborative environment, this opportunity is tailor-made for you.

About Us: Arkansas Maxillofacial Surgery Center is a leading and well-established oral surgery practice dedicated to delivering comprehensive oral and maxillofacial surgical services. We take pride in offering cutting-edge treatments, state-of-the-art facilities, and a patient-centered approach that focuses on delivering outstanding outcomes and compassionate care.

Benefits: We offer a competitive compensation package that includes:

 Compensation Range $500,000 - $750,000  Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance coverage.  Retirement savings plan with employer matching.  Continuing education opportunities to support your professional growth.  Access to cutting-edge technology and state-of-the-art facilities.  Supportive and collaborative work environment that values teamwork and innovation. 

Join Our Team: If you are passionate about making a positive impact in the field of oral and maxillofacial surgery, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us at Arkansas Maxillofacial Surgery Center and be part of a dedicated team that is committed to excellence in patient care and surgical expertise. Together, we can shape the future of oral surgery and improve lives one procedure at a time.

Responsibilities

 Perform a wide range of oral and maxillofacial surgical procedures, such as dental extractions, dental implants, bone grafting, orthognathic surgery, and TMJ procedures.  Develop personalized treatment plans based on patients' needs, medical history, and clinical findings to ensure optimal results and patient satisfaction.  Collaborate closely with our team of experienced clinicians, dental professionals, and support staff to ensure seamless patient care and interdisciplinary coordination.  Stay current with the latest advancements in oral surgery techniques, technology, and research, and integrate them into your practice to provide the best possible care.  Provide clear and thorough explanations of surgical procedures, risks, and benefits to patients and their families to foster open communication and trust. 

Qualifications

 DDS/DMD from an accredited Dental School  Certificate from an accredited US Oral Surgery Residency Program  Active Dental License in the state of practice 

At DCA we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them and recognize the value this brings to our patients and employees. DCA is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees. We won't unlawfully discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, Veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law.

The DCA team is best characterized by the relationships we have with our patients and each other. We embrace collaboration which is necessary to innovate in today’s changing world of dentistry . Our culture encourages participation, diversity of thought, innovation, and strong execution.

Go further with an Ally

#rup

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

If you are a skilled oral surgeon seeking an exciting opportunity to advance your career while enjoying the beauty of Boynton, FL, consider joining Boynton Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Implant Center!

About Us: Boynton Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Implant Center is a leading healthcare facility in Boynton Beach, FL, dedicated to providing exceptional oral and maxillofacial surgical care. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology and staffed by experienced professionals committed to excellence.

Job Description: Boynton Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Implant Center is seeking a full-time Oral Surgeon to join our dynamic team. As an Oral Surgeon, you will have the opportunity to utilize your skills and expertise to provide a wide range of surgical services, including extractions, dental implants, corrective jaw surgery, and more. Join our dedicated team to deliver personalized care and achieve optimal patient outcomes.

Benefits of Joining Boynton Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Implant Center:

 Competitive earning potential between $500,000 to $750,000 annually  Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision coverage  Retirement savings plan with employer matching  Continuing education opportunities to support professional development  Supportive work environment with state-of-the-art facilities and equipment  Opportunity for career growth and advancement within our organization 

Join Us in Beautiful Boynton, FL: Located along the stunning Florida coastline, Boynton Beach offers endless opportunities for outdoor recreation, cultural attractions, and a vibrant community atmosphere. With its year-round sunshine, pristine beaches, and diverse dining and entertainment options, Boynton Beach is the perfect place to live, work, and play.

Apply Today: If you are a passionate oral surgeon seeking a rewarding career opportunity with competitive earning potential and the chance to make a difference in the lives of patients, we encourage you to apply for our full-time Oral Surgeon position at Boynton Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Implant Center . Come be a part of our team and experience the beauty of Boynton, FL firsthand!

Responsibilities

 Performing Oral and Maxillofacial Surgical Procedures: Utilize your expertise to perform a wide range of surgical procedures, including dental implant placement, tooth extractions, corrective jaw surgery, and facial trauma reconstruction, with precision and proficiency.  Providing Compassionate and Personalized Patient Care: Ensure patients' comfort and well-being throughout the treatment process. Educate patients on their oral health conditions, treatment options, and post-operative care instructions.  Collaboration: Collaborate closely with our team of dental professionals, including dentists, hygienists, and support staff, to deliver comprehensive and coordinated care to our patients. Maintain open communication and contribute to a positive and supportive work environment.  Delivering Clinical Excellence: Uphold the highest standards of clinical excellence and adhere to established protocols and best practices in oral and maxillofacial surgery. Stay updated on the latest advancements and techniques in the field to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.  Practice Growth: Actively participate in practice growth initiatives and contribute to the development and implementation of strategic plans to expand our patient base and enhance our reputation as a leading oral surgery practice in the Boynton area.  Ensuring Compliance and Accurate Documentation: Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, including OSHA, HIPAA, and state dental board regulations. Maintain accurate and thorough documentation of patient records and treatment plans. 

Qualifications

 DMD or DDS degree from an accredited dental school  Completion of an accredited oral and maxillofacial surgery residency program  Board certification or eligibility for board certification in oral and maxillofacial surgery  Current state dental license in good standing  Excellent clinical skills and a commitment to delivering exceptional patient care  Strong communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment 

#rup

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

Are you a skilled and passionate Oral Surgeon seeking an opportunity to make a meaningful impact on patients' lives? Look no further than Murfreesboro Oral Surgery and Implant Center! We are currently seeking a dedicated and talented Oral Surgeon to join our dynamic team on a full-time basis. Join our team and contribute to transforming lives through exceptional oral care.

About Us

Murfreesboro Oral Surgery and Implant Center is a reputable and patient-centered practice dedicated to providing exceptional oral surgery care to our community. With state-of-the-art facilities, a collaborative environment, and a commitment to the highest standards of patient care, we pride ourselves on our ability to transform lives through innovative treatments and compassionate interactions.

Position Overview

As a Full-Time Oral Surgeon at Murfreesboro Oral Surgery and Implant Center, you will play a pivotal role in providing a wide range of oral surgery services to our diverse patient base. Your expertise will contribute to our mission of delivering top-tier oral health care, enhancing patients' quality of life, and building lasting relationships within the community. Join our team and make a meaningful impact on patients' lives through exceptional oral care.

What We Offer

 Compensation Range $500,000 - $750,000  Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, dental coverage, and retirement plans.  State-of-the-art facilities and equipment to support your expertise and provide exceptional patient care.  Collaborative and supportive work environment that values teamwork and professional growth.  Continuing education opportunities to stay at the forefront of the field. 

How To Apply

If you are a skilled Oral Surgeon with a passion for excellence and a commitment to transforming lives through exceptional oral care, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume, cover letter, and references through our online application portal.

At Murfreesboro Oral Surgery and Implant Center, we believe in the power of skilled professionals coming together to make a difference. Join us in our mission to provide outstanding oral surgery care and become an integral part of our patient-focused team. Apply today and embark on a rewarding journey with us.

Responsibilities

 Perform a variety of oral surgical procedures, including extractions, dental implants, bone grafting, orthognathic surgery, and more. Utilize your expertise to provide comprehensive oral health care and transform patients' lives.  Evaluate patients' oral health and develop personalized treatment plans tailored to their specific needs. Provide individualized care to enhance patients' oral well-being.  Collaborate with our team of skilled professionals, including dental assistants, nurses, and administrative staff, to ensure seamless patient care. Foster a collaborative environment to enhance the overall patient experience.  Provide pre-operative and post-operative instructions, and address patients' questions and concerns to ensure their comfort and well-being throughout their treatment journey.  Stay updated with the latest advancements in oral surgery techniques and technologies to continuously improve the quality of care provided. 

Qualifications

 DDS/DMD from an accredited Dental School  Certificate from an accredited US Oral Surgery Residency Program  Active Dental License in the state of practice  ABOMS Certification

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

Are you a skilled and passionate Oral Surgeon seeking a rewarding opportunity to showcase your expertise and make a significant impact on the lives of patients at Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo? Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo is excited to announce a full-time Oral Surgeon opening, and we invite you to join our dynamic team dedicated to providing exceptional oral healthcare.

Position Overview

As a Full-Time Oral Surgeon at Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo , you will play a pivotal role in our commitment to delivering high-quality, patient-centered care. We are seeking a talented and compassionate professional who is eager to contribute to our mission of improving oral health and enhancing the overall well-being of our community.

Shift Schedule

This position at Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo follows a 3-1-3-7 shift schedule, offering a balanced work-life structure that allows you to excel in your professional responsibilities while enjoying valuable personal time.

Benefits

 Compensation Range $500,000 - $750,000  Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.  Retirement savings plan.  Continuing education opportunities.  Supportive and collaborative team environment. 

How To Apply

If you are a dedicated Oral Surgeon looking for a fulfilling career with a progressive practice, we invite you to apply. Join Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo and be part of a team that prioritizes patient care, professional growth, and work-life balance.

At Oral Surgery Specialists of Pueblo , we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage qualified candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Elevate your career and make a difference in the lives of our patients – apply today!

Responsibilities

 Perform a wide range of oral and maxillofacial surgical procedures, including extractions, dental implants, corrective jaw surgery, and more.  Diagnose and treat various oral conditions and diseases.  Develop and implement personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.  Collaborate with our team of dental professionals to ensure comprehensive patient care.  Maintain accurate patient records and documentation.  Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in oral surgery techniques and technologies.  Provide excellent patient education and post-operative care instructions. 

Qualifications

 DMD or DDS degree from an accredited dental school.  Completion of an accredited oral and maxillofacial surgery residency program.  Board certification or eligibility for board certification in oral and maxillofacial surgery.  Active state dental license in Colorado.  Strong clinical and interpersonal skills.  Commitment to delivering high-quality patient care.  Ability to work collaboratively with a team of dental professionals.

data.title: Systematic Crypto Trader/PM
data.description:
Position Overview: The firm is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Systematic Crypto Trader to join their dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of at least 2 years in live trading cryptocurrencies and must possess robust strategies that can be integrated into our trading systems for optimal performance.
Responsibilities:Develop and implement systematic trading strategies for cryptocurrencies.Conduct in-depth research and analysis to identify profitable trading opportunities.Monitor market trends and adjust strategies accordingly to maximize returns.Collaborate with the research and technology teams to enhance trading algorithms and infrastructure.Maintain thorough documentation and performance tracking of trading strategies.
Requirements:Minimum of 2 years of successful live trading experience in cryptocurrency markets.Proficient in developing systematic trading strategies using quantitative analysis and data-driven methodologies.Strong understanding of market dynamics, risk management, and trading psychology.Demonstrated track record of generating consistent profits and managing risk effectively.Excellent programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or C++.Experience with trading platforms and tools such as Bloomberg, TradingView, or similar.Bachelor's degree in finance, mathematics, computer science, or related field (preferred but not required).

data.title: Patent Attorney
data.description:
Title: Patent Attorney (Entrepreneurial-Minded w/ a Portable Book of Business) Location: United States (100% Remote)Salary: $130k-$700k+ (Uncapped Earning Potential)
Haraka Headhunters LLC is a legal search firm specializing in corporate attorney placements. We are currently working with a top-tier boutique law firm that is experiencing exponential growth and is looking to add a few more entrepreneurial-minded patent attorneys to their team.
What We Are Looking For...Keen interest in business developmentRegistered and in good standing with the USPTOMust be able to leverage book of business upon hireAt least 5+ years of patent preparation and prosecution experienceMust have a portable book of business with a total annual net worth of 150k minimumElectrical engineering background preferred (we are open to computer engineering, computer science, or chemistry disciplines)
Education Requirements:JD or LLM from a US ABA-Accredited Law SchoolUndergraduate degree in electrical engineering, computer engineering/science, or chemistry (advanced degree preferred)
What We Are Offering...Specialized support staffHighly skilled marketing teamFlexibility to work 100% remotelyAdvantageous marketing budget for your brand/practiceOverall support and camaraderie from industry specialistsUnparalleled work/life balance as well as the luxury of time to conduct business development
Feel free to e-mail your resume directly to: Tiffany@HarakaHeadhunters.com ***We are offering a $200 referral bonus in the event that you refer an attorney who is hired by our client***

data.title: Oral Surgeon
data.description:
Overview

Are you a skilled and compassionate oral surgeon looking to take your career to the next level? Northern Virginia Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery Associates is excited to announce a full-time opening for an exceptional Oral Surgeon at our cutting-edge practice in Manassas. We're seeking a dedicated professional to join our dynamic team and contribute to our commitment to excellence in patient care.

About Us: Northern Virginia Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery Associates is a renowned leader in oral and maxillofacial surgical care in the Manassas region. With state-of-the-art facilities and a team of experienced professionals, we offer a comprehensive range of surgical services, including dental implants, wisdom teeth removal, corrective jaw surgery, and more. Our patient-centered approach and emphasis on the latest technological advancements ensure that our patients receive the highest quality care in a comfortable and supportive environment.

Position Overview: As a Full-Time Oral Surgeon with our practice, you will have the opportunity to showcase your exceptional surgical skills and contribute to the growth and success of our team. You will collaborate closely with our team of skilled professionals, including surgeons, nurses, and administrative staff, to deliver top-notch patient care and create positive surgical experiences.

Includ Ed

 Strong patient referral system  Competitive and uncapped earning potential  Clinical autonomy to diagnose and treat patients  Patient Care centric practice  Modern facilities and equipment  Established business support allowing the providers to focus on patient care  Complete range of benefits for full-time employment 

Benefits

 Earning Potential: $500k - $700k per year  Comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, and retirement plans.  Supportive work environment with a collaborative and skilled team.  State-of-the-art facilities and advanced surgical technology.  Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.  Work-life balance with a predictable schedule. 

Location: Our practice is located in the vibrant city of Manassas, offering a perfect blend of urban amenities and suburban tranquility. Enjoy a thriving cultural scene, excellent schools, and easy access to outdoor activities.

Apply Today: If you are a talented and driven oral surgeon looking to make a significant impact in the field, we invite you to join our esteemed team at Northern Virginia Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery Associates. Take the next step in your career journey by submitting your resume. Your expertise will be valued, and your contributions will shape the future of oral surgical care.

Responsibilities

 Perform a wide range of oral and maxillofacial surgical procedures with precision and expertise.  Diagnose and develop treatment plans for patients based on their individual needs.  Collaborate with our interdisciplinary team to provide comprehensive patient care.  Maintain accurate patient records and documentation.  Stay updated with the latest advancements in oral surgery techniques and technologies.  Uphold the highest ethical and professional standards in patient care and communication. 

Qualifications

 DDS/DMD from an accredited Dental School  Certificate from an accredited US Oral Surgery Residency Program  Active Dental License in the state of practice 

At DCA we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them and recognize the value this brings to our patients and employees. DCA is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees. We won't unlawfully discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, Veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law.

The DCA team is best characterized by the relationships we have with our patients and each other. We embrace collaboration which is necessary to innovate in today’s changing world of dentistry . Our culture encourages participation, diversity of thought, innovation, and strong execution.

Go further with an Ally
